721255f-a.text:
Madison Ave., at the S.E. corner of East 3lst Street. Shown is the Madison Ave. Baptist Church. To-day (1937) the Roger Williams Apartment House stands directly at the corner, while the church has retained the 31st Street Puilding (shown with Electric Sign over portico) for an entrance.
March 22, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.

721256f-a.text:
Madison Avenue, west side, from East 31st to 32nd St's. Prominently shown is the Corticelli Silk building at the N. W. corner of 31st Street. Note in the background the unfinished framework of the Empire State Building on 5th
Avenue, at 34th Street.
August 2, 1930
P. L. Sperr

712001f-a.text:
31st Street, at the north east corner of Madison avenue.
Mugust 2, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.

721258f-a.text:
Madison Avenue, south from 32nd Street.
Gn S.E. corner a building for the Suscguehanna Silk Mills is being erected on the Cockcroft property, formerly occupied by two old
residences.
Gn west side, may be seen the Remsen Building on S.W. corner of 32nd Street and the Backer Building on N.W. corner of 31st Street,
on site of an old apartment house of the 1880's.
1916.
Irving Underhill, Photographer.
qift of E.M. Jenks.
